comments.body:
I don't think we should list all the commands in the `.rst` file. The main reason I think that is because if we change a flag in the original script or modify more flags it is easy to forget to update that in the doc.

And a user can simply get this by `breeze --help` and will probably make this file small & concise :)

It's generally nice if you can see all the commands in the web docs. I think this is something I always look for in this kind of documentation (there are people who prefer web docs than command line --help in general). Also it makes it google-searchable and web-viewable, which is rather nice if you are looking for some answers and you have no tools handy (like when you are answering someone's comments on slack and you only have your phone with you),

For example all gcloud commands have something like that: https://cloud.google.com/sdk/gcloud/reference/

I wanted to make it automated in the near future (like doctoc in .md files) so it does not get out-of-sync - this should be rather easy to do but it's already a huge change and I would love to get it out :).
